business.headline: How to get a student credit card? Check eligibility and documents requiredWhile the credit card can be a valuable financial tool, students must be aware of its potential misuse and pitfalls.

I will think about India: Nirmala Sitharaman as Trump 2.0 goes big on cryptoFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that the government during its G20 presidency pushed for a global understanding of crypto regulations and how to tackle trading in cryptocurrencies.

Market rally: Sensex jumps 1,397 points, Nifty nears 23,750 as bulls take chargeStock Market: The S&P BSE Sensex surged by 1397.07 points to close at 78,583.81, while the NSE Nifty50 added 378.20 points to end at 23,739.25.

Exclusive: Nirmala Sitharaman on Budget 2025 tax relief for citizensFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated that the tax relief introduced in Budget 2025 reflects Prime Minister Narendra Modi's commitment to honouring taxpayers for their contribution to nation-building.

Why did Hindenburg go after Adani Group? Nathan Anderson breaks silenceHindenburg Research founder Nathan Anderson maintained that all the firm's reports, including the one on Adani Group, were accurate.

Nirmala Sitharaman dismisses tax relief link with Delhi electionFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman dismissed speculation that the government increased the tax relief to Rs 12 lakh due to the upcoming Delhi elections.
No plans to shut it down: Nirmala Sitharaman on old tax regimeFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman table the Union Budget 2025 on February 1, 2025.

Respecting service of taxpayers: Nirmala Sitharaman on Budget income tax breaks Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharman said that the tax relief given in Budget 2025 was Prime Minister Narendar Modi's effort to respect the service the taxpayers are doing for nation building.

5 key tax reforms for middle class introduced in Budget 2025 Union Budget 2025: The new tax structure announced in the Union Budget 2025 aims to ease the financial burden of the middle class, enhancing their disposable income and giving a boost to their consumption levels.
Consumption vs capex: Has the government prioritised spending over growth?Budget 2025 provided tax relief for taxpayers, but the government also maintained its fiscal deficit target at 4.4% of GDP.

Budget 2025: What's in it for farmers, agriculture and rural businesses?Budget 2025 aims to modernise India's agricultural landscape and reinforces the government's commitment to sustainable agriculture and farmer empowerment.

Sensex jumps over 1,000 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayAt 1:34 PM, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 981.63 points at 77,918.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 286.90 points to trade at 23,647.95.
Sensex, Nifty rebound after sharp fall after global trade concerns easeThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 522.62 points to 77,709.36, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 142.15 points to 23,503.20 as of 9:30 AM.

Will PF deposit interest rate go up? EPFO board to meet on February 28The Central Board of Trustees (CBT), which is led by the Union Minister for Labour and Employment, is the top decision-making body of the (Employees Provident Fund Organisation) EPFO.
Trade war fears spook markets: Sensex, Nifty take a hit as rupee weakensThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked by 319.22 points to end at 77,186.74, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 128.85 points to close at 23,353.30.

Explained: Why Volkswagen has sued Indian authoritiesAccording to the government, Volkswagen broke down imports of some VW, Skoda, and Audi cars into separate components, instead of declaring them as completely knocked down (CKD) units.
India reviewing crypto stance amid global policy shift: ReportIndians have poured money into cryptocurrencies in recent years despite the country's tough regulatory stance and steep trading taxes.

Earn over Rs 12.75 lakh? You can still pay zero tax under new regimeWith a standard deduction of Rs 75,000 under the new regime, salaried taxpayers earning up to Rs 12.75 lakh annually do not need to pay any tax. But what if you have a higher annual income, say Rs 13 lakh or more? You could still end up paying no tax.

New income tax slabs: Check how much you'll save with these simple calculationsBudget 2025: Tax experts explain how the new income tax changes impact taxpayers across income levels, from Rs 6 lakh to Rs 1 crore, after the fresh proposals in the Union Budget 2025.

Volkswagen sues Indian authorities over $1.4 billion tax notice: ReportThe tax dispute began in September 2024, when Indian authorities issued a $1.4 billion tax notice to Volkswagen's Skoda Auto Volkswagen India unit.

entertainment.headline: Vivekanandan Viralanu: Here's where you can watch the Tom Chacko releaseMalayalam actors Shine Tom Chacko and Swasika's Vivekanandan Viralanu will soon be available to stream on an OTT platform. The announcement was shared by makers on social media recently.

Boman Irani on The Mehta Boys vs Animal debate: Not every father-son film is sameActor Boman Irani, who is all set to make his directorial debut with The Mehta Boys, reacts to Animal comparisons, stating not all father-son films are alike. Avinash Tiwary jokes that theirs offers the real family drama.

Sarah Michelle Gellar to star in Buffy the Vampire Slayer sequel: ReportActor Sarah Michelle Gellar will reportedly be reprising her role as Buffy Summers for Buffy the Vampire Slayer's sequel on Hulu. Chloe Zhao is in talks to direct the show.

Game Changer OTT release: When and where to watch Ram Charan-Kiara Advani filmRam Charan's Game Changer OTT release date: Shankar's telugu directorial, Game Changer, is all set to stream on OTT soon. Read details about when and where you can watch the Ram Charan and Kiara Advani-starrer on OTT.

Karisma Kapoor recreates Hum Saath Saath Hain scene with Badshah on Indian Idol 15Actors Karisma Kapoor, Mohnish Behl and filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya were among the special guests on Indian Idol 15. During their appearance, Karisma recreated one of her iconic scenes from Hum Saath Saath Hain with Badshah.

Dining With The Kapoors: Kareena, Ranbir, and family bond over food and filmsThe entire Kapoor Khandaan including Kareena Kapoor, Ranbir Kapoor, Karisma Kapoor, and others have united for a Netflix special film, Dining With the Kapoors. The project was announced as a part of the Netflix 2025 slate.
Did Samay Raina joke about Rekha on Amitabh Bachchan's KBC 16? Here's the truthA viral video shows Samay Raina joking about Rekha with Amitabh Bachchan on KBC 16, but it appears to be doctored.

Pics: Sonu Nigam performs at Rashtrapati Bhavan after suffering back painSonu Nigam performed at Rashtrapati Bhavan despite suffering from a severe back spasm just a day back. The singer performed on the occasion of Rashtrapati Bhavan Diwas.

Associated Press apologises to Babyface for cutting short Grammy interviewAP apologised to 12-time Grammy-winning composer Babyface after cutting his interview short on the Grammys red carpet. Stars like Khloé Kardashian criticised the journalists for disrespecting the music legend.

SRK jokes about being 'Naam ka producer' at son Aryan's directorial launchShah Rukh Khan launched his son, Aryan Khan's directorial debut project, The Ba***ds of Bollywood, on February 3. During the Netflix event, the actor referred to himself as 'naam ka producer'.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood: SRK launches son Aryan Khan's directorial debut Shah Rukh Khan launched the upcoming project, The Ba***ds of Bollywood, which marks the directorial debut of his son, Aryan Khan. The actor unveiled the announcement video during the Netflix 2025 event.

Test teaser: R Madhavan, Nayanthara and Siddharth set for 'test of life'The teaser of TEST, starring R Madhavan, Nayanthara and Siddharth was unveiled on Monday. The upcoming cricket drama will stream on Netflix this year.

The Royals teaser: Zeenat Aman makes a comeback in Ishaan, Bhumi's royal love storyThe teaser of Ishaan Khatter and Bhumi Pednekar's The Royals is finally out. Set to stream on Netflix, the upcoming drama also stars Zeenat Aman, Sakshi Tanwar and Milind Soman in key roles.

The Tale of Lady Ok review: Lim Ji-yeon stars in a standout historical K-dramaReleased-Mon Jan 06, 2025Unlike most Joseon-era dramas that revolve around kings, queens, and court politics, The Tale of Lady Ok dares to step outside the palace. Read on.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter teaser: Neeraj Pandey promises darker, grittier sagaFilmmaker Neeraj Pandey's Khakee The Bengal Chapter was unveiled at the Netflix event today, February 3. The upcoming series will feature Prosenjit Chatterjee, Saswata Chatterjee, Parambrata Chatterjee, and others in key roles.

Akka teaser: Keerthy Suresh, Radhika Apte fight for supreme power in YRF's showNetflix unveiled the first look teaser of its highly-anticipated period thriller drama, Akka. It stars Radhika Apte and Keerthy Suresh in indomitable avatars.

Ishq Mein song from Nadaaniyan: Ibrahim and Khushi bring their A-game in romanceThe team of Nadaaniyan released the first song from the film on Monday. The Netflix romantic drama marks the debut of Ibrahim Ali Khan with Khushi Kapoor.

Kohhra 2 teaser: Barun Sobti leads a 'smooth and silky' but intense sequelBarun Sobti and Mona Singh feature in the sequel to Kohhra on Netflix. The teaser of the series promises an intense and mysterious experience by director Sudip Sharma and Faisal Rahman.

Aap Jaisa Koi teaser: R Madhavan, Fatima in a heartwarming tale of love, laughterActors R Madhavan and Fatima Sana Shaikh are all set to share screen space in the upcoming drama, Aap Jaisa Koi, on Netflix. The streaming giant shared the teaser on February 3.

Rana Naidu 2 teaser: Arjun Rampal joins Rana Daggubati, Venkatesh in tricky face-offThe teaser of the much-awaited Rana Naidu 2 was unveiled at a grand event on Monday. The second installment features a stellar cast of Venkatesh Daggubati, Rana Daggubati, Surveen Chawla and Arjun Rampal.

general news.headline: Some focus on jacuzzi, stylish showers: In Parliament, PM targets Arvind KejriwalWhile replying to the Motion of Thanks on President's Address in Lok Sabha, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took a veiled jab at Arvind Kejriwal, saying that some political leaders only focussed on "jacuzzis and stylish showers".

PM recommends book on Nehru, jabs Congress, social media digs out excerptsPM Modi's remark is being seen as a counter to Rahul Gandhi's assertion that the government sent the External Affairs Minister 'three or four times' to the US to secure an invitation to Donald Trump's inauguration.

5 people shot in attack at school in Sweden's OrebroThe police said five people were confirmed shot in an attack at a school in Sweden. Police said that the case is currently being investigated as "attempted murder, arson, and an aggravated weapons offence".

No Bumrah in India's ODI squad for England series amid concerns over fitness India vs England: Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah was not part of the updated ODI squad, announced by the BCCI on Tuesday. Bumrah has been racing against time to recover from a back injury in the lead-up to Champions Trophy, starting February 19.

Bryan Johnson needn't worry, Indians have lungs of steelA shocking post by American biohacker and longevity influencer Bryan Johnson on India's air quality has sparked a heated discussion on how we have normalised toxic air.

Shots fired at singer Prem Dhillon's house for 'betraying' Sidhu MoosewalaShots were fired at Punjabi singer Prem Dhillon's residence in Amritsar. Claiming responsibility for the attack, the Jaipal Bhullar gang accused the singer of betraying Sidhu Moosewala, who was shot dead in 2022.

Trump begins mass deportation: How many Indians will be impacted?A US military aircraft carrying 205 Indian nationals departed from Texas for Amritsar on Tuesday as part of Trump's mass deportation plan.

PM cites RK Laxman cartoon, slams Rajiv Gandhi's 'hawa hawai' 21st century talksPrime Minister Narendra Modi accused late former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi of being "disconnected from reality" while citing a RK Laxman's famous cartoon to push his point while slamming him.

Out or not out? Sachin Tendulkar, Glenn McGrath reunite for hilarious adSachin Tendulkar and Glenn McGrath rekindle nostalgia in a hilarious ad, playfully revisiting the legendary 1999 Adelaide shoulder-before-wicket dismissal, with Tendulkar cheekily suggesting an eye check-up for McGrath in a fun twist on the controversial moment.

A Celebration of Rohit Bal's Legacy at Blenders Pride Fashion Tour 2025A grand celebration of Rohit Bal's iconic work at Blenders Pride Fashion Tour brought together his closest friends, industry icons, and admirers in an unforgettable evening honouring his legacy and artistic brilliance.

Why did Hindenburg go after Adani Group? Nathan Anderson breaks silenceHindenburg Research founder Nathan Anderson maintained that all the firm's reports, including the one on Adani Group, were accurate.

Delhi's richest election candidate has assets worth Rs 259 crore. Details hereA report by Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) revealed that BJP's Karnail Singh is the richest candidate to be contesting the Delhi Assembly elections this year. Delhi goes to polls tomorrow, results will be declared on February 8.

Watch: A tiger was chasing a wild boar and it didn't end 'well' for bothAccording to reports, early in the morning, villagers noticed that the tiger and wild boar struggling to stay afloat in the well which was located in the field. Without wasting time, the villagers informed the forest department.

'Age-reversing' CEO walks out of Nikhil Kamath's podcast, blames it on India's AQIRecalling his experience while shooting the podcast, the age-reversing CEO said, "Inside, the AQI was 130, which is equal to smoking 3.4 cigarettes for 24 hours of exposure."

Respecting service of taxpayers: Nirmala Sitharaman on Budget income tax breaks Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharman said that the tax relief given in Budget 2025 was Prime Minister Narendar Modi's effort to respect the service the taxpayers are doing for nation building.

PM shreds Rahul Gandhi over 'boring' remark: Those who do photo-ops in jhuggis...PM Narendra Modi, participating in the motion of thanks to the President's address in the Lok Sabha, also taunted the Congress for giving false 'gareebi hatao' slogans for five decades.

Indian bride with alopecia ditches wig, embraces bald look. Emotional wedding videoNeehar Sachdeva, a content creator based in the US, made the internet cry happy tears after her wedding video and pictures went viral on social media.

Kumbh stampede not that big: Hema Malini reacts to Akhilesh Yadav's chargeBJP MP Hema Malini on Maha Kumbh stampede: Saying that it is Akhilesh Yadav's job "to speak wrongly," Hema Malini slammed Samajwadi Party chief over his "exaggerated" remarks on Maha Kumbh stampede.

41% of job seekers face ghosting: LinkedIn expert's 4-step strategy to avoid itFeeling ghosted by prospective employers during your job search? LinkedIn India's Senior Managing Editor, Nirajita Banerjee, offers four practical steps to stop getting ignored, boost your job search strategy, and improve your chances of landing that desired role.

'Pressure tactics': AAP vs poll body after case against Atishi day before electionDelhi Election: Joining Atishi's tirade against the central poll body, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said that anyone who raises their voice against BJP's "hooliganism" will be targeted by Delhi Police and the Election Commission.

Eat, shower, sleep in bed? Inside this unusual science studyBeing conducted by the European Space Agency (ESA), the study will see volunteers not using their feet for 60 days in a bid to mimic what astronauts feel in zero gravity.

Nirmala Sitharaman defends Bihar Budget bonanza: Long waiting for developmentNirmala Sitharaman, speaking at the India Today-Business Today Budget Round Table, said Bihar was 'long waiting' for development and the Budget proposals should not be seen through a political lens.

How Congress shot itself in the foot with caste surveysCaste survey, which the Congress has been using as political rhetoric with success, could turn into a major headache for the party. With the release of the Telangana caste survey's findings, demands for its implementation are gaining traction right before local body polls in the state. The Congress is also a divided house and is sitting on the Karnataka caste survey report prepared seven years ago.

Kejriwal is preferred Delhi CM by a mile, but is that enough?The latest C Voter survey in the aftermath of the Union Budget reveals that a near certain victory for the Aam Aadmi Party is becoming a knife-edge contest.

Fantastic Four teaser: Pedro Pascal leads 'the family' of Marvel misfitsThe first teaser trailer of Marvel Cinematic Universe's Fantastic Four is here, and it promises oodles of excitement and misadventures. It releases in cinemas this July.

Vicky Kaushal says 'no hello, no goodbyes' with Akshaye Khanna on Chhaava setsVicky Kaushal, in an interview, shared that he did not exchange any pleasantries with Akshaye Khanna on the Chhaava sets. The two actors will be seen playing the roles of Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj and Aurangzeb.

French actor Juliette Binoche to head Cannes Film Festival juryFrench actor Juliette Binoche, who was nominated for an Academy Award, was recently announced as the jury head of the upcoming Cannes Film Festival.

Vidaamuyarchi advance booking: Thala Ajith's film set for smashing openingAjith Kumar's Vidaamuyarchi is set for a solid opening on Friday. The early advance booking trends predict good numbers for the film. In fact, there are high chances that it will end up surpassing Daaku Maharaaj and Sankranthi Vasthunam.

sports.headline: No toxic competition between 'friends' Abhishek, Yashasvi and me: Shubman GillIndia vs England: Vice-captain Shubman Gill said he enjoyed watching 'friend' Abhishek Sharma find success in the T20I series against England, ruling out 'toxic competition' in the team. Gill will be Rohit Sharma's deputy in the upcoming ODI series.

Karun Nair's Champions Trophy snub: Shubman Gill says 'continuity' key for IndiaShubman Gill commented on Karun Nair's snub from the Champions Trophy squad and claimed that the Indian team needs continuity at the moment. Karun impressed for Vidarbha during the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

MS Dhoni's inspiring speech to students: Success not dependent on a pin code anymoreMS Dhoni delivered an inspirational message to over 3,50,000 students during an event on Tuesday, February 4. Dhoni said that success is not dependent on pin code any more and advised students on how to handle pressure.

Rohit Sharma should continue aggressive batting in Champions Trophy: Raina Suresh Raina said that Rohit Sharma should continue with his aggressive style of batting in the Champions Trophy. Last year, Rohit scored 157 runs in ODIs on the tour of Sri Lanka at a strike-rate of 141.44.

No Bumrah in India's ODI squad for England series amid concerns over fitness India vs England: Fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah was not part of the updated ODI squad, announced by the BCCI on Tuesday. Bumrah has been racing against time to recover from a back injury in the lead-up to Champions Trophy, starting February 19.

Spinner Varun Chakravarthy added to India's ODI squad for series vs England: BCCIIndia vs England: After a stellar show in the T20I series, Varun Chakravarthy earns a call-up to the ODI squad. The spinner started training with the team in Nagpur on Tuesday.

Champions India get hero's welcome in Bengaluru after World Cup winThe Indian U19 team returned home on Tuesday after winning the U19 Women's T20 World Cup 2025 in Malaysia. Friends and family of players were present at the Bengaluru airport to greet Niki Prasad and the other Indian cricketers.

Watch: Team India gets rousing reception on homecoming after U19 T20 World Cup win Niki Prasad's India returned to India on Tuesday and were welcomed with a rousing reception at the Bengaluru airport. On Sunday, India won the U19 Women's T20 World Cup after beating South Africa in the final.

Head also said that he could move back to the middle order for the final.

Varun Chakravarthy trains with ODI squad amid Champions Trophy speculationIndia vs England: Spinner Varun Chakravarthy was seen training with the Indian one-day international squad in Nagpur on Tuesday. Speculation is rife that Varun will be added to India's Champions Trophy squad.

Joe Root explains how coach Brendon McCullum helped his batting Joe Root has praised England coach Brendon McCullum for expanding his perspective on the game, crediting him with unlocking new possibilities in his approach. Root has scored 12,972 Test runs, placing him fifth on the all-time batting list.

Who will captain RCB? COO Rajesh Menon tight-lipped ahead of IPL 2025IPL 2025: COO Rajesh Menon, in an interview with India Today, expressed the franchise's delight with their auction performance but remained tight-lipped about the team's captain for the 2025 season.

Dimuth Karunaratne set to retire after milestone 100th Test in GalleSL vs AUS: Sri Lanka star Dimuth Karunaratne is likely to retire from international cricket after playing his 100th Test in Galle. Karunaratne will make his 100th red ball appearance for Sri Lanka in the second Test against Australia.

Asensio ready to 'measure' himself in Premier League with Aston VillaMarco Asensio, seeking redemption after a tough PSG spell, joins Aston Villa on loan. With Premier League football offering a fresh challenge, the former Real Madrid star aims to rediscover his best form under Unai Emery.

IND vs PAK, Champions Trophy tickets sold out within minutes of going liveChampions Trophy: Tickets for the highly anticipated India vs Pakistan clash at the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 were sold out within minutes, leaving thousands of fans scrambling to secure seats for the most electrifying fixture of the tournament.

Cricket West Indies introduces 'data-driven scouting' to develop local talentCricket West Indies (CWI) has embraced a data-driven scouting system to identify and nurture local talent, signifying a departure from traditional methods. This initiative by Cricket West Indies ensures a comprehensive evaluation of emerging players, offering them a structured advancement pathway.

Cristiano Ronaldo reveals he almost joined FC Barcelona before UnitedCristiano Ronaldo revealed he was close to joining Barcelona before signing for Manchester United in 2003. The Portuguese legend's revelation has left fans stunned, considering his iconic rivalry with Barça during his Real Madrid years.

Suryakumar, Dube named in Mumbai squad for quarterfinal vs HaryanaRanji Trophy 2025: Suryakumar Yadav and Shivam Dube have been included in Mumbai's 18-member squad for their Ranji Trophy quarterfinal clash against Haryana. Suryakumar and Dube were part of India's squad for T20I series against England.

Petra Kvitova to return to action after 15-month maternity breakTwo-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova confirmed that she was returning to action seven months after giving birth to her son. Kvitova is set to return to competitive action at the WTA 250 tournament in Austin, Texas.

McCullum praises Abhishek Sharma's Wankhade 100: As good as we've ever seenIND vs ENG ODI: Brendon McCullum hailed Abhishek Sharma's 135-run blitz in Mumbai as one of the finest T20I knocks ever, admitting England had no answers to the young batter's fearless assault in India's emphatic 150-run victory.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
